intro: Wikstroemia lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf sandarac, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, often appearing in spring. It is typically found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. The bark of Wikstroemia lanceolata contains a resinous substance that has been used historically for various purposes.
